title: What's News: World-Wide — WSJ
text:
This article is being republished as part of our daily reproduction of WSJ.com articles that also appeared in the U.S. print edition of The Wall Street Journal (September 5, 2019).

Hong Kong's chief executive said she would withdraw the extradition bill that sparked months of unrest in the city, a major concession to protesters' demands.

U.K. lawmakers imposed twin defeats on Johnson, frustrating his effort to take Britain out of the EU at the end of October and thwarting his push for a quick election.

Hurricane Dorian moved toward the Carolinas on Wednesday night, threatening large-scale flooding and powerful winds.

The Trump administration imposed sanctions on what Washington called an Iranian "oil-for-terror" exporting network.

A prominent ally of Mexico's president has financial ties to companies that profited from a deal at the center of a corruption scandal, documents show.

Mexico's stepped-up effort to deport Central American migrants crossing its southern border has slowed the flow into the U.S.

Democratic lawyer Greg Craig was acquitted by a federal jury on a felony false-statement charge stemming from work for Ukraine.

Stephen M. Hahn, a radiation oncologist, has emerged as a leading candidate to be nominated as FDA commissioner.

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

September 05, 2019 02:47 ET (06:47 GMT)
